intro: Vellozia bradei, commonly known as the Brade's vellozia, is a striking member of the Xanthophyllaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that form dense, grass-like rosettes. The plant produces strikingly colorful, showy inflorescences with bright yellow or orange flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Vellozia bradei thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
